| Mark Wegner, Brian Runge, Fieldin Culbreth, Jim Joyce, Paul Nauert
}} The '{{mlby|2008}} [[National League Division Series]]' ('NLDS'), the opening
round of the 2008 National League playoffs, began on Wednesday, October 1 and
ended on Sunday, October 5, with the champions of the three NL divisions and one
wild card team participating in two best-of-five series. They were:

* (1) Chicago Cubs (Central Division champions, 97â64) vs. (3) Los Angeles
  Dodgers (Western Division champions, 84â78): Dodgers win series, 3â0.
* (2) Philadelphia Phillies (Eastern Division champions, 92â70) vs. (4)
  Milwaukee Brewers (Wild Card qualifier, 90â72): Phillies win series, 3â1.

The underdog Dodgers swept the Cubs to advance to the NLCS, while the Phillies
defeated the Brewers by three games to one. The series marked the first
postseason series victory for the Dodgers since winning the 1988 World Series,
and the first such victory for the Phillies since the 1993 NLCS.
